how-to-break-into-tech.title: AI Chats: How to Break into Tech
how-to-break-into-tech.description: This is an event that can help connect students during recruitment season by giving students the opportunity to ask their peers at UTD how they were able to break into big tech internship positions

presenters.name:
- Yeshas Nath
- Aamir Mohammed
- Sreevasan Sivasubrama
- Prem Kishnani

f2025kickoff.title: Fall 2025 Kickoff
f2025kickoff.description: Welcome to the Fall 2025 Semester of AIS! Kickoff is the best place to get started - we‚Äôll be announcing new programs, events, and officer positions.

hackai-2025.title: HackAI
hackai-2025.description: A fun day of hacking, learning about AI, and networking with industry professionals and fellow students!

issa-collab-s25.title: AIS x ISSA Workshop
issa-collab-s25.description: We‚Äôre excited to welcome Anmol Agarwal, M.S., Cybersecurity Analyst at Nokia and Adjunct Professor at The George Washington University, for an insightful event on AI/ML and Cyber Defense Info! Whether you‚Äôre new to cybersecurity or looking to deepen your expertise, this is a fantastic chance to learn from a true practitioner and educator.

fin-mod-wrkshp.title: Financial Modeling Workshop
fin-mod-wrkshp.description: Learning how to interpret 3-statement models and regression algorithms in python to predict financial success!

biotech-alphafold.title: Alphafold and Applications of Biotechnology - Bio Tech Collab
biotech-alphafold.description: Learn about the applications of biotechnology in artificial intelligence and alphafold.

ml-in-qf.title: AIS x QFC: Machine Learning in Quantitative Finance
ml-in-qf.description: Join us for an exciting collaboration between QFC and AIS as we explore the intersection of machine learning and quantitative finance. Learn how AI techniques are carefully applied to stock market analysis through stochastic processes, with a special focus on avoiding overfitting and managing financial risk. This workshop will demonstrate how advanced models like Geometric Brownian Motion can be calibrated using machine learning to create more accurate market predictions.

valentines-social.title: Valentine‚Äôs Social
valentines-social.description: Valentine‚Äôs day is coming up! ü•∞ We got a speed-networking social just for you üòâ Bring a friend or partner to enjoy the loveeee

ai-chat-deepseek.title: AI-Chats: DeepSeek
ai-chat-deepseek.description: Join us for an AI Chats session featuring Professor Xinya Du as he explores how DeepSeek is changing the way AI models are trained with simpler, more efficient methods. Professor Du, a distinguished faculty member and NSF CAREER Award recipient, will lead an engaging discussion on how DeepSeek is making AI more accessible while achieving impressive results.

meet-the-mentors-s25.title: Meet the Mentors! (AIM)
meet-the-mentors-s25.description: Join us for ‚ÄúMeet the Mentors‚Äù @ 7pm, January 27th! Here, you will have the opportunity to learn more about the projects that you could work on with our AIM Program (AI Mentors Program) and the bright student mentors that will be guiding you throughout the semester!

kickoff-s25.title: AIS Kickoff S25
kickoff-s25.description: Come learn what AIS is all about and what events are coming up this semester!

ai-hot-chocolate.title: Karaoke and Hot Choco-AI-late Game Night
ai-hot-chocolate.description: Social event. We will be serving hot chocolate, have karaoke, board games, and AI rap music activity.

pexplexity-workshop.title: Perplexity Workshop ML Monday
pexplexity-workshop.description: Alex Lang, the AI Engineering Leader at Perplexity will come to speak

xai-ml-monday.title: Explainable AI ML Monday
xai-ml-monday.description:
XAI is the study of unboxing models and understanding/explaining the results produced by these models. Doing this helps us understand the model better and trust its results as we would know what's going behind the scenes
We will breifly be going over what problem XAI solves (Why it is required), techniques/methods which can solve those problems and maybe example usecases

tech-tank-f24.title: Tech Tank F24
tech-tank-f24.description: Tech Tank is a student-run conference that connects students with industry professionals during an inspiring day of learning and networking.

comms-workshop.title: AIS Officer Personal Development and Communications Workshop
comms-workshop.description: Communication, personal development and team bonding activities

resume-wkshp-2024.title: Resume Workshop
resume-wkshp-2024.description: Resume workshop with industry speaker and interactive workshopping of resume. Students will also have the opportunity to get their resumes reviewed by AIS reviewers

nlp-gpt-f24.title: Intro to Natural Language Processing & GPT
nlp-gpt-f24.description: Join us as we dive into a basic history on the evolution of how people have used computers to process and extract meaning from text, and more recently to generate text with generative AI chatbots like ChatGPT.

walle-f24.title: AI Movie Night
walle-f24.description: Join us for Wall-E, the story of a humble robot going about their simple life compacting trash on a barren earth long after humans left it, until one day...the humans send another robot to check how things are going there. Watch to find out what unexpected twists unfold as she meets Wall-E and is introduced to other interesting discoveries that make the plot much richer than the description above

visual-ai-in-cars.title: AI in Cars
visual-ai-in-cars.description: Come learn about how AI is used to help cars see, leading to developments like automated driving

aim-acm-nlp-workshop.title: AIM x ACM Natural Language Processing Workshop

dallas-ai-panel-s24.title: Dallas AI Panel
dallas-ai-panel-s24.description:
Dallas AI is a collective of industry leaders in the field of machine learning / AI:  
[https://dallas-ai.org/](https://dallas-ai.org/)

This event will give students an opportunity to learn about real-world data science and speak with industry leaders around Dallas.

cisco-ai.title: Empowering the Future: AI Innovation at Cisco

aim-social-s24.title: AIM Social
aim-social-s24.description: A night of food and games for members of AIM and Open AIM

ethics-s24.title: Ethics in AI
ethics-s24.description: Learn about some of the ethical obligations of AI professionals as we dive into some of the ethical guidance material provided by Huggingface

eval-visual-s24.title: Model Evaluation
eval-visual-s24.description: In this workshop, we‚Äôll be explaining the basics of data visualization in Python, along with a brief survey of some of the most common methods for evaluating the performance of your AI models

ml-monday-3-s24.title: ML Monday - Classic Machine Learning
ml-monday-3-s24.description: We will be going over several common machine learning techniques in both supervised and unsupervised learning

ml-monday-2-s24.title: ML Monday - Exploring Neural Networks
ml-monday-2-s24.description: A dive into neural networks and deep learning, with a special focus on gradient descent optimization.

ml-monday-1-s24.title: ML Monday - Google Colab & Jupyter
ml-monday-1-s24.description: Introduction to Python using Google Colab and Jupyter, along with an overview of basic libraries such as NumPy and Pandas.

meet-the-mentors-s24.title: Meet the Mentors
meet-the-mentors-s24.description: Meet our Spring 2024 AIM mentors and hear project ideas

kickoff-s24.title: AIS Kickoff Spring 2024
kickoff-s24.description: A little bit about us and a showcase of what‚Äôs going on in the club this semester

fastai-s22.title: FastAI
fastai-s22.description: Come join us for a workshop on FastAI, a deep learning library, and get some hands-on experience with deep learning!

hackai-23.title: HackAI
hackai-23.description: Student-run hackathon organized by the Artificial Intelligence Society at UTD, aiming to connect today's students with the knowledge and resources needed to build Artificial Intelligence related projects in the span of 24 hours.

ai-conference-s22.title: AI Conference
ai-conference-s22.description: Join AIS UTD for a day of learning more about artificial intelligence at our 2022 AI conference! We have a day full of speakers, workshops, and networking opportunities planned for you all to learn more about AI and its applications in different industry fields, along with research currently being done in the field. Whether you are new or experienced in this field, we invite you to this awesome experience!

ml-in-games-s22.title: Machine Learning in Video Games
ml-in-games-s22.description: Come join us to learn more about ML and its applications in game development

aim-night-s22.title: AIM Night
aim-night-s22.description: We will be holding a night to present the projects of our AIM (AI mentorship) program participants took part in.

nlp-talk-s22.title: NLP Talk
nlp-talk-s22.description: We are holding an interactive seminar discussion to talk about Natural Language Processing and sub-topics related to it with Dr. Mithun Balakrishna, a professor at UTD that has expertise in NLP. Students will be encouraged to come to the discussion with questions or comments to encourage a seminar type of discussion.

ai-ethics-talk-s22.title: AI Ethics Talk
ai-ethics-talk-s22.description: We plan on holding an interactive seminar discussion with Vamsi Nellutla to come to speak about the AI Ethics talk, specifically about using ML models for patient data at a Fortune 5 healthcare insurance company in an ethical way and other sub-topics. We will have our speaker guide the conversation and encourage our audience to speak up and bring questions or comments like an interactive seminar. We plan on using tables and chairs to allow people to sit somewhat close for it to be interactive.

hand-sign-recognition-s22.title: Real-Time Hand Sign Recognition
hand-sign-recognition-s22.description: This project will teach new users how to use technologies such as OpenCV, Tensorflow, and MediaPipe Hands to process and classify real-time Hand Signs for translating American Sign Language into readable english

ethical-algorithms-s22.title: Ethics of AI in Medicine
ethical-algorithms-s22.description: This event will include James (a representative from the Harvard-MIT MTS program and a previous employee at PathAI) and a representative from UTD‚Äôs Starling Lab. They will be discussing using AI to advance medicine and the ethical dilemmas that come with progress.

explainable-ai-s22.title: Explainable AI with Dr. Gopal Gupta
explainable-ai-s22.description: We will be holding a collaboration with Dr. Gopal Gupta's research lab to hold a workshop over the tools that they have been building such as FOLD-R++, which work on concepts of Explainable AI, over various Kaggle Datasets. Dr. Gopal Gupta's Applied Logic Programming-Languages and Systems (ALPS) Lab are researching a concept called Explainable AI. Explainable AI is about providing patterns from data, which can inform people about why the model performed the way it did. The lab is making algorithms such as FOLD-R++ in Python, which generates Prolog rulesets that show patterns (Explaining AI decisions) it detects from datasets.

ai-startup-panel-s22.title: Local AI Startup Panel
ai-startup-panel-s22.description:
As of now, this will be a panel type of event. We will have a moderator first ask the panelists variety of type of questions such as what made you start a start-up, how did you go about acquiring customers and making a profit, what factors did you consider in choosing your partners, and how does the Dallas startup scene differ from other locations. We will then hold a brief Q&A to allow our audience members to ask questions and then hold networking/advertising contact information at the end. 

Test: [Google](https://www.google.com/)

presenters.name: Sr. Applied Scientists (NLP) Hong Kang from Pieces

adversarial-checkers-s22.title: Learning Adversarial AI with Checkers
adversarial-checkers-s22.description: In this workshop, we will learn many of the most fundamental techniques used in adversarial AI, which pits one AI against another, through checkers. Topics will include minimax search, alpha-beta pruning, evaluation functions, and many other ways to improve the speed and performance of a checkers AI. The workshop will also be supplemented by an interactive Google Colab illustrating the concepts we learned and what kind of impact they make on the adversarial agents.

ais-kickoff-s22.title: AIS Kickoff
ais-kickoff-s22.description: This event will kickoff the start of the Spring 2022 semester. We will give an introduction of the organization and what our plans are for the semester. It can also be used as a networking event to meet officers in the organization.

cisco-aiml-f21.title: Cisco x UTD AIS: Guiding Your Career in AI/ML
cisco-aiml-f21.description: Speaker Shirin Khan will share her story about how she transitioned from a business background to a customer-focused career in technology in AI/ML at Cisco. There will be a discussion about innovative Cisco products using AI/ML that are changing the way people work. Recruiter Melanie-Lark Benning will offer insights into the recruiting process at Cisco and how you can build your career in technology with the company. Password: fYSeMJJ4

aim-presentations-f21.title: AIM Presentation Night
aim-presentations-f21.description: UTD AIM will be presenting their semester long projects to professors and public audience. Professors will give feedback on their projects and professors and audience are free to start short conversations with each group about their research/semester long project. It is an event to showcase what each AIM group has achieved throughout the semester.

ais-member-social-f21.title: AIS Member Social
ais-member-social-f21.description: Members can play games and chill, and interact with the AIS team!

ais-rl-f21.title: Reinforcement Learning
ais-rl-f21.description:
This event is to learn the fundamentals of reinforcement learning and how to get started with topics such as QLearning and apply them in projects.
Access Passcode: lJ2m.4*j

ais-fundraiser-f21.title: Boba With AIS
ais-fundraiser-f21.description: We will be hosting a fundraiser to raise funds for AIS UTD by selling a variety of Boba Tea. Please come to support our organization and socialize with our fellow members!

ais-podcast-f21.title: The AI Talkshow
ais-podcast-f21.description: A podcast with the co-founder of [DeepRisk.AI](DeepRisk.AI), Chaitanya Vaidya, regarding AI, the industry and startups

intro-to-comps-f21.title: How to Win Kaggle Competitions
intro-to-comps-f21.description:
This is basically going over the kaggle competition that will be running from the 15th to 22nd.
Winners of the contest will be announced at this event.
We will also go over solutions for the kaggle contest and tip and tricks on how to do well in general machine learning competitions

deep-learning-intro-2-f21.title: Intro to Deep Learning 2
deep-learning-intro-2-f21.description: Basically a deep dive into deep learning theory (neurons, gradient descent, activation functions, a lot of mathy stuff). Make sure to put on there to brush up on their calculus. There will also be a kaggle contest at the end

enter-ai-industry-f21.title: Landing a Job/Internship in AI
enter-ai-industry-f21.description: Our first AI panel this semester to provide advice from our AIS alumni holding jobs in AI/ML related positions and perspective from experienced engineers and directors at companies on how to land a job in the AI industry, as well as offer insight on the trend and skills to learn for this field.

kickoff-f21.title: AIS Kickoff
kickoff-f21.description: Come join us in-person or tune in virtually to learn more about the Artificial Intelligence Society and what we have planned for the upcoming semester, from workshops to hackathons! Experienced or not, we have something for you. Food is provided while supplies last!

deep-learning-intro-f21.title: Introduction to Deep Learning
deep-learning-intro-f21.description: This will give an overview and introduction of deep learning, specifically the math behind it and implementing them in TensorFlow

intro-to-python-f21.title: Introduction to Python
intro-to-python-f21.description: An introduction to Python, a popular language used by beginners and loved by the AI community for its extensive libraries and support! This workshop is specifically geared towards people with absolutely no programming experience whatsoever, so come on over to learn something new!

ai-movie-night-s21.title: End of Summer AI Movie Night
ai-movie-night-s21.description: Bring your snacks and drinks and join us for a movie night social where we‚Äôll be watching and discussing a movie that surrounds Artificial Intelligence! To determine which movie will be selected, take your vote in the #announcements channel on the AIS Discord before Thursday at midnight!
ai-movie-night-s21.joinLink: [aisutd.org/discord](aisutd.org/discord) (the social itself will be on the üçï | social-hangouts voice channel)

ama-nagar-s21.title: Ask Me Anything with Dr. Nagar
ama-nagar-s21.description: The event would be an Ask Me Anything (AMA) event, similar to a Q&A panel but w/ one person in the spotlight, where the speaker and participants will be able to have a discussion regarding anything AI related.

license-plate-recognition-s21.title: License Plate Recognition
license-plate-recognition-s21.description: This workshop showcases how to use OpenCV and EasyOCR to detect license plates from images.

attack-image-datasets-s21.title: Exploring Adversarial Attacks on Image Datasets
attack-image-datasets-s21.description: AI is increasingly adopted in multiple fields. Yet, it still remains vulnerable to malicious applications. Learn about adversarial attacks and watch as we demonstrate an attack on an image classification model and cause it to make faulty predictions.

genetic-algorithms-s21.title: Genetic Algorithm Presentation + Visualization
genetic-algorithms-s21.description: A presentation about genetic algorithms with an accompanying online visualization.

nlp-tutorial-1-s21.title: Intro to Natural Language Processing Part 1: Defining Your Words with Word Embeddings
nlp-tutorial-1-s21.description: Take a sneak peek at the field of NLP and how computers understand human‚Äôs language through the use of word embeddings. Also, try your hand at building your first dictionary for computers!

emotion-recognition-s21.title: Emotion Recognition in Comics
emotion-recognition-s21.description: EmoReCom is built for a competition to develop a vision-text method to recognize emotions in comic scenes. This project guides you how to turn ideas into your first submission in an AI competition.

analyzing-movie-reviews-s21.title: Analyzing Sentiment of Movie Reviews
analyzing-movie-reviews-s21.description: An exploration of sentiment analysis and natural language processing

new-in-ai-s21.title: What‚Äôs New in AI and ML
new-in-ai-s21.description: A light-hearted series of demos and experiments showcasing the best and state-of-the-art of modern methods in machine learning and artificial intelligence.
